title: Why Doesn't Anyone Care About The Toxic Community?
body:
Why doesn't anyone care about the awful community?

I have loved LoL since the moment I started playing it 3 years ago. It is easily my favourite game in existence when looking strictly at the game play itself. But I have been at the breaking point for years in regards to the community. And it just seems like no one cares and it doesn't get any better. 

Since I started playing this game in S2 the community has been incredibly toxic. Every game you join you have someone in your game trolling, trash talking, or just BMing in general. Sure you can mute and you can report but it doesn't do anything. And why should we have to? Why are these people allowed to ruin the game for others? 

People act like this because they can get away with it. LoL has the absolute worst community I have ever seen on a game. And I have played a lot of games in my 23 years. LoL is perhaps the worst community in gaming history. 

We get all these promises about how they are going to reward positive play and punish negative play and IT NEVER HAPPENS. I've waited 3 years for this community to be improved but Riot is not willing to make the implementation to do so. 

And no one cares but I officially don't enjoy this game anymore because the community has ruined it for me. I'm going to go play the thousands of other online games with respectful player bases that help and better each other instead of chop down and insult each other.

replies.body:
Part of the reason we call it 'toxicity' is because it spreads; one player starts saying bad things, another player gets agitated and contributes to the overall toxicity of the game. What we see time and time again is the players who see toxicity in more of their games often are being toxic in them as well.

I would ask the OP -- and anyone else who feels they see toxic players in all of their games -- to take a moment and consider that perhaps there's something they can be doing differently to reduce the amount of toxicity in their games. In cases of verbal abuse, being quick to just mute someone who is verbally abusive fixes *so* many situations.

Sorry, but I have to call you out on this.
We've all had games where we've said nothing, done nothing except try our best, and had players randomly decide to flame or troll.
Sure, it's not in every single game, but it's still in a *significant percentage*.

Sure, most of us aren't saints.  I occasionally get annoyed at people or make some harsh comment, but by and large I try to be positive, and never say anything too extreme even when I do get annoyed.  Yet I see at least one toxic player *in the vast majority of my games*.  Maybe the toxicity is only minor (e.g. wanting to false-report players who just played badly, or some minor verbal abuse), but it's nearly always there.

Instead, most of the time people become toxic for things completely unrelated to the behaviour of other players - they make stupid mistakes and feel they have to blame and flame someone else; they feel that they cannot win and decide to troll to get the game over faster; an ally plays badly and so they decide that they need to flame them instead of helping them; an ally picked a champion that they disapprove of, so they don't want to try or want to make them lose for their pick; and so on.
These are attitude problems on the part of the toxic player, ***not*** the fault of the other players on their team.  Sure, sometimes you can try to talk them out of these destructive behaviours, by encouraging them to believe that they can still win and to keep trying, but most of the time you can't, and they'll just verbally abuse you for trying.
You can't just say "play better and carry your games so your allies will be less toxic".

Muting is a patch-fix for a problem that's already happened, it's not a solution to stop the problem in the first place.

About two years ago, I did an experiment where I kept track of the levels of toxicity that I saw in ranked games.  I played 168 ranked games at Gold ELO, and **81.55%** of those had some level of toxicity, with 57.15% having medium or higher toxicity.  The situation has improved very slightly since then, but not significantly.

That's unfortunate. My kids who also play and have been playing longer always comment on how nice I am. Yet I see trolls, and very toxic people in every single game I play. I tried the ranked games, and oh boy are they near unplayable. In ten games I had nine where there was a troll there trying to lose the game for both teams, seriously both teams.

They then proceed to insult everyone, and criticize every single move the other players make. If that isn't bad enough, they eventually go afk, or link dead entirely leaving you to a lost game. Both of my boys, my two cousins, and one  of their friends quit playing League of Legends because of the toxic environment and the constant trolling. That's five people, and at one point I was trying to get my wife to play the game with me since she plays PvP in other games with me. I've stopped asking her to play and I myself am considering the option of quitting this game too because of the toxic players. So that's seven potential players paying for stuff you could have playing, but you only have one hanging on by a thread.

I beg you guys to start taking this seriously because it is bad right now. To add insult to injury 3v3s have so many bots playing it is unplayable too.

Wait for Riot to post and tell you you're the source of the problem. Same they did to me. They just cant seem to grasp that even well mannered players are seeing the toxicity a majority of the time. 

Fix your damn game please Riot.

No other PvP game has a player base as negative as yours. **You are obviously doing something wrong.**
Yeah I'm actually shocked they would say that.
I'm actually surprised that the post basically telling us "it's all your own fault, nothing is wrong" got upvotes.

I must admit that I can never bring myself to actually *recommend* League of Legends to anyone because of this.  How could anyone in good conscious recommend a game to someone when you know that it will only subject them to constant abuse?

I have played, and do play a lot of games for PvP. I have never seen a game with more toxic players in it. League of Legends has a pretty toxic player base. I also will not recommend this game to anyone either. The constant abuse is unreal.

While I knew that a comment was coming at some point that said, "The community isn't the problem you're the problem." I really didn't expect it come from a Riot employee but I am quite glad that it did as I am interested in further discussing this with you and getting your input.

Sure, I don't claim to be a saint never-ever having contributed to any sort of in game toxicity. But more often than not I don't contribute. Since I know how awful this community is, I can usually see the toxicity coming from a mile away. If I see a bunch of people bickering and being jerks in camp select, my whole team is muted as soon as we spawn so I can avoid the entire unpleasant experience that I know is coming. If people start arguing mid game, same thing applies.

But my question is, why should we have to put up with this? Why should we have to regularly mute players on our team or our entire team to avoid the negative player experience. Why cant Riot start implementing a better punishment system to deter these people from behaving like this in the first place? It really cant be that hard. Many other games seem to do a fine job keeping their player base in check. I have played a lot of games. In most of those games, you run into pleasant players on a regular basis who are enjoyable to play with. I find this very rare in LoL. Also, in other games I find trolls, toxic players, etc, to be very far and few between. But they seem to run rampant here. The only logical explanation to me is that this is because THEY CAN GET AWAY WITH IT ON LOL.

Can you explain to me why you guys don't enforce stricter rules and steeper punishments?

That's how it spreads and the attitude that some people are only toxic because they have been the target of toxic behavior is why it remains such a problem. Players can't be allowed to pass the toxic buck and anything to the contrary is a defence of those perpetrating the negative behavior. > I would ask the OP -- and anyone else who feels they see toxic players in all of their games -- to take a moment and consider that perhaps there's something they can be doing differently to reduce the amount of toxicity in their games. In cases of verbal abuse, being quick to just mute someone who is verbally abusive fixes so many situations.

First off this is pure and simple victim blaming. Again this extremely disturbing from a player behavior specialist. That said muting is a powerful tool that can fix a lot. In a game if you have been flamed once, even if you mute them, your teammates still have to listen to that player. I can't force them to mute that person and i will still see if they respond to that person so i'm still being exposed to the effects of that one person so in order to solve the problem i have to mute my entire team in a game where clear communication is key to victory and the lack of communication is a reportable offence. 

If this response came from someone on a skins team or technical engineer i might understand, because muting is a useful tool. Coming from a player behavior specialist this response just sounds like "feel lucky we gave you a mute button our job is done" and you aren't looking to improve the situation. 

Tell us how you can do better. 

Tell us what you are doing to improve the situation. 

Don't defend the toxic people. 

Don't blame the people who are their targets for not muting.

**@Slumber Jack**

Honestly, this game has been advancing so well with so many new concepts, champions, game modes, skins, ect.. but the one thing I have noticed more than ever is that almost every game you are in, even if you say not a word and ping mia or so forth people are going to attack you. The ADC flipped on him , called him retarded amongst many other things. So I told him to quit it and stop being a jerk, that it was a team and we had to act like one to win. He goes "stfu bitch, I am going to carry your horrible asses anyways" Then I responded with, if you continue this attitude I will report you. The person then decides to brag about how he doesn't get in trouble, that Riot does shit for it, he has been playing 5 years gets reported all the time and never gets in trouble for it. This isn't the first time I have seen this. People have even gone as far in matches from what I have seen , 2 people premade together, one is harassing another player, that person mutes them. So the guy says "sorry but  I am muting you please use pings." The friend then starts typing out everything the guy that was muted was saying so his friend can continue to torture that player. I really wish you guys would stop with the crazy game modes for a moment, and some other things to fix this and make game play more enjoyable and hold people accountable for their actions.

My 2 cents: I've been playing this game for awhile now (>4.5 years) and the community has improved dramatically from when I started.

A couple months ago I started getting empirical with my approach to reviewing the toxicity in a day of playing LoL. Generally only one in five games or less had someone toxic and I found that by calling them out on it generally made then stop.

I mostly play teambuilder now, but even when I venture into other queues I don't see higher levels of toxicity.

Try  performing this experiment: after every match, write a note if there was someone toxic in the game. If there was, ask yourself if there was anything you could have done to head the toxicity off. Could you have asked people to calm down? To stop insulting the jungler who got his buffs taken early? Then next time you see someone being toxic step in and try to get people to vain down and play.

I see a lot of posts asking Riot to fix the community, but they have a different perspective then us, the regular players. If every player were to step in when someone was being toxic the community would improve faster then it would of we wait for Riot to invent the magic bullet that will fix it. The bullet doesn't exist. They are trying their best, but we as a community also have a responsibility to help, not just complain.

Actually the community isn't as toxic as people tend to think it is.

For the most part, almost all people who complain about the community being toxic are toxic a lot themselves.

There's a lot of reasons and correlations to this of course.

I've played ( 9 ) games today. Out of the ( 9 ) games on one side or the other there was ( 3 ) afk'rs, ( 1 ) LD, and ( 19 ) toxic players on one side or the other. Just now in my first promo since my return to the game this season our Rengar saw I was in Promo's and proceeded to feed laughing in chat that he was making me lose a promo game. Since I'm the person I am and stuff like that doesn't bother me, he began to flame me in chat trying to make me mad. I have to admit that after fifteen minutes he decided to stop since he wasn't getting a rise out of me.

That's the community I see. I see this when I play, when my kids play, when my cousins play, and when friends play. You can not have a competitive game when you have people willing to lose games like that.

After awhile I just get tired of winning, or losing games because someone chooses not to be a team player.

This is simply not true.  Not if you are playing Ranked.
No matter how many times people repeat this won't make it any more true.

I've been playing this game heavily since season 1.  Never been punished or banned, have hundreds of points of honour, all the honour-based rewards.  Does that sound like a toxic player?  At the very worst I'm what Riot call a "neutral player".
Yet I see harsh flaming, people intentionally losing games, ragequitting, trolling, and so in a significant portion of my games.  Non-toxic games which don't involve at least some flaming or a few people demanding false reports on teammates for playing badly are rare enough to be a novelty.

Now how often do you actually see real toxicity? Most of the toxicity people claim to see is actually something that isn't enough to warrant a warning.

There's severe bias. You never remember the larger amount of games where you didn't really notice toxicity all that much, you just remember the ones that were toxic a lot better and it gives you a bias. 

Fact is, lyte actually did real research on this, and even did a forum post about it. Lyte asked for people to give an impression on their past 10 games, and then he'd compare it with their match/chat logs for the past 10 games. Surprisingly, most people who were neutral or positive had 1-2 toxic people in the past 10 games, and they were usually chat restricted already. Everyone who claimed that there was toxicity readily apparent in the past 10 games where actually really toxic themselves, like really toxic. They created the toxicity and got set off by the simplest things. To them, they'd make a bad play, someone would say "Youchamionhere...", and they'd get set off from that.

Poor lyte thought people were trolling him, because everyone who said they a lot of toxicity in the past 10 games where extremely toxic.

Thats why Slumber Jack says that if you notice a large amount of toxicty in your games that you should check yourself, because chances are you're wrecking yourself. He's not just saying it out of his ass, I mean, it's pretty much a fact at this point.

Its the same on reddit as well. A reddit mod mentioned that people who often complained about how toxic the community was are people who already have gotten warnings from the mods for toxicity themselves.

There's certainly bias.

However, about a year and a half ago, I played 168 ranked games and wrote down the levels of toxicity in them.  Only around 20% of games had none at all, and a little over half had medium toxicity or higher.  Roughly 20% were "ruined" by trolls or leavers.

That's why I can't understand Lyte's results.  They don't match what I've seen in-game in ranked at all.
His sample pool was mostly players who didn't play ranked, though, and was also exclusive to the NA region, so maybe that has something to do with it?

I see a lot of very light toxicity that usually isn't enough to warrant any real response, and like you said real full fleshed toxicity is rather rare, like 2/10~ which is pretty much what it is.

When I play and i'm in the 'zone' I just mute who ever, good or bad, that causes me to look at the chat to much. 

Neutral and positive players usually just figuratively and/or literally ignore people who be to annoying.
I wouldn't call ~2/10 "rare", though. That's an amazingly high statistic, we only consider it rare because we're so used to it.  It's certainly a huge step away from the 1% that Riot claim.
2/10 games roughly goes to 2/100 people.

Just adjust to the conditions the trolls have set for you, and keep playing. Sure you'll lose probably but at least you learn a little in the process. Make everything a positive experience instead of pointless bitching. I have played for almost two years now and I have yet to feel like this game is too toxic. It's just about your attitude and willingness to adjust.
